sn2.22:4.1: Standing to one side, the god Khema recited these verses in the Buddha’s presence:
sn2.22:6.1: It’s not good to do a deed
sn2.22:6.2: after doing which you burn up;
sn2.22:7.1: It’s good to do a deed
sn2.22:7.2: after doing which you don’t burn up;
sn2.22:8.2: what you know is for your own welfare.
sn2.22:8.3: A thinker, a sage would not proceed
sn2.22:9.1: Suppose a cart driver leaves the highway,
sn2.22:9.3: They enter upon a rough road,
sn2.22:9.4: and fret when their axle breaks.
sn2.22:10.1: So too, an idiot departs the good
sn2.22:10.2: to follow what’s against the good.
sn2.22:10.3: Fallen in the jaws of death,
sn2.22:10.4: they fret like their axle’s broken.”
